verses.roman:
tina pāde anuprāsa dekhi anupama
eka pāde nāhi, ei doṣa 'bhagna-krama'

synonyms: tina pāde—in three lines; anuprāsa—alliteration; dekhi—I see; anupama—extraordinary; eka pāde—in one line; nāhi—there is not (alliteration); ei doṣa—this fault; bhagna-krama—deviation.
translation: "There is extraordinary alliteration in three lines of the verse, but in one line there is no such alliteration. This is the fault of deviation.
